FuncDef: The display pki certificate command displays the content about the CA or local certificate loaded to the device. The display pki certificate command displays the content about the CA or local certificate loaded to the device.
CLIs: display pki certificate { ca | local | ocsp } [ filename <file-name> ]
display pki certificate default { ca | local } [ key-pair-typersa ]
display pki certificate { ca | local } [ realm <realm-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the PKI realm name of a certificate to be checked.
The PKI realm name must already exist.

Displays content about the CA certificate.
-

Displays content about the local certificate.
-

Displays content about the Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) server's certificate.
-

The value must be an existing certificate file name.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the content of the default built-in certificate.
-

Sets the key pair type to RSA.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display pki certificate ca realm test
ExtraInfo: This command shows information about the CA certificate, local certificate, and OCSP server's certificate, including signature algorithm, issuer, validity period, subject, and subject public key.
